document_data.name: Animental
document_data.mainbody:
'''Animentals''', also known as '''element creatures''' and occasionally referred to in some of their rarer forms as '''elemental monsters''',

Whenever animals died on the Prime Material their life energy went to an appropriate [[Outer Plane]], often times the [[Beastlands (plane)|Beastlands]], but a residual part of their energy would typically get shunted through vortexes into one of the many [[Elemental planes]]. 

Instead of becoming a [[petitioner]] like most souls that left the Prime Material, this residual force would coalesce into a duplicate of its former body, composed of its respective [[plane]]'s element. This same process could occur with monsters, though such cases were rare. Even then, [[humanoid]] animentals were not known to exist.

Description.Primary Elements:
For example, an element creature of [[air]] would be made up of shifting clouds, with darker bits of fog for their eyes and mouth. An element creature of [[Earth (element)|earth]] would be made up of stone, earth, and soil, with multifaceted crystals for eyes. And an element creature of [[fire]] would have flames in place of hair or fur, with blue flames for eyes. Any armor or scales of their Prime counterpart would be replaced with charcoal and blackened ash.

An element creature of [[water]] would have a viscous, fluid body with coral in place of their mouth and glowing green orbs for eyes. They were also likely to have serpentine or fish-like forms.
Description.Para-Elements: An element creature of [[Frostfell (plane)|ice]] would be composed of snow, rime, and ice. With reddish ice for eyes and mouths lined with icicles. Some were very angular in form. An element creature of the [[Para-Elemental Plane of Magma]] would be composed entirely of magma, hardened into rock at some places while still fiery and molten at other spots, such as their joints. In place of eyes they had burning [[coal]]s and their mouths were full of flame. Element creatures of [[Para-Elemental Plane of Ooze|ooze]] appeared as dark brown masses of muck, with gaping black pits where their eyes and mouth should be. And finally, an element creature of [[Para-Elemental Plane of Smoke|smoke]] would be composed entirely of a thick, dark cloud of that element with red-hot cinders for eyes and tendril-like claws.{{Cite dragon/347/Paraelemental Paragons|60-61, 63}}
Description.Quasi-Elements: Elemental creatures of the [[Quasi-Elemental Plane of Radiance|Plane of Radiance]] and [[Quasi-Elemental Plane of Vacuum|Plane of Vacuum]] had spherical forms of force, being colored and invisible respectively. Those from the [[Quasi-Elemental Plane of Lightning]] took on both spherical and spherical oblong forms of energy with leg-like bolts jutting in all directions. Elemental creatures of [[Quasi-Elemental Plane of Minerals|minerals]] had more of an insectoid appearance compared to their Prime planar counterparts. Elemental creatures of [[Quasi-Elemental Plane of Salt|salt]] were white and encrusted with [[salt]].

document_data.Behavior: All animentals, regardless of their spirits' Prime counterpart, were of a [[neutral]] disposition. Some described them as mindless beings, though their intelligence was on par with their Prime counterparts.
document_data.Abilities:
Animentals were impervious to harm from their respective elemental. They could fly or swim through it with ease, though their movement remained similar to that of their Prime counterpart. They were capable of sensing creatures on the [[Border Ethereal]] of their respective plane. Elemental creatures were also immune to [[poison]]s, paralysis, and the spell ''[[sleep]]''.

Animentals mimicked the abilities of their Prime counterpart, as well as possessed abilities unique to their element. The abilities they mimicked from their Prime counterpart could remain the same depending upon the element their spirit was composed of — for example, a [[medusa]] reborn as an animental of earth would still petrify her victims. But generally, the mimicked abilities of animentals conformed around their respective element  — the spirit of a medusa reborn as a fire animental might turn her victims into ash, pillars of fire, or volcanic [[obsidian]].

Much like other elementals, animentals reverted to their component element when "killed," such as a [[bat]] animental of Earth crumbling away into a pile of stones.
document_data.Combat: Animentals fought in the same manner as their Prime counterparts.
document_data.Rumors & Legends:
Rumors circulated among the planes of there being animental [[giant]]s, but no proof of their existence was ever found. Others claimed that animental humanoids were the progenitors of [[genie]]s.

Prior to the [[Time of Troubles]], some believed that animentals, as well as the rarer elemental monsters, were both merely temporary containers for elemental force that had achieved some semblance of sentience.

Ecology.Diet: The dietary habits of animentals could vary, though generally they were carnivorous due to the lack of plant matter in many of the Elemental planes.
Ecology.Habitats:
Animentals were almost never found outside their respective elemental plane. Though there were some exceptions to this rule, as [[fire bat]]s were occasionally encountered inside volcanoes on the Prime Material. 

Outside of the primary elements, there were also element creatures of wood, who inhabited the [[House of Nature]].

Element creatures of ice were known to exist in [[Auril]]'s realm of [[Winter's Hall]].
Ecology.Relationships:
Other elemental creatures generally ignored animentals, viewing them as a sort of phantom. Though some were known to use them as guards or even pets.

Whenever a [[spell]] that summoned animals, insects, or monsters was cast in the Inner Planes, an appropriate animental was typically summoned instead.

Primary Elements.[[Elemental Plane of Air]]: There were known to exist animental counterparts of [[cow|bull]]s, [[camel]]s, [[mastiff]]s, [[polar bear]]s, [[axebeak]]s, [[criosphinx]]es, [[giant rat]]s, [[owlbear]]s, as well as [[rat]]s in the form of [[vapor rat]]s.<ref group="note" name="Creatures">In the [[Manual of the Planes 1st edition|''Manual of the Planes'' 1st edition]]'' there a few instances of animental giants and [[goblin]]s listed in each Elemental plane. They are not listed here due to later sources discounting their existence.''
Primary Elements.[[Elemental Plane of Earth]]: There were known to exist animental counterparts of [[black bear]]s, [[giant slug]]s, [[jackals]], [[pegasi]], and [[treant]]s.<ref group="note" name="Creatures" />
Primary Elements.[[Elemental Plane of Fire]]: There were known to exist animental counterparts of [[bird]]s, [[shark]]s, [[aarakocra]], [[griffon]]s, [[leucrotta]]s, [[otyugh]]s, [[roper]]s, [[quipper]]s, as well as [[bat]]s in the form of [[fire bat]]s.<ref group="note" name="Creatures" />
Primary Elements.[[Elemental Plane of Water]]: There were known to exist animental counterparts of [[displacer beast]]s, [[elephant]]s, [[giant leech]]es, [[giant weasel]]s, and [[whale]]s.<ref group="note" name="Creatures" />

Para-Elements.[[Para-Elemental Planes]]: Across the various Para-Elemental Planes there were known to exist animental counterparts of herd animals, [[behir]]s, [[cave fisher]]s, [[cloaker]]s, [[dinosaur]]s, [[eagle]]s, [[electric eel]]s, [[giant octopus|giant octopi]], [[rat]]s, and [[urchin]]s.

Quasi-Elements.[[Quasi-Elemental Plane of Ash]]: The animentals that occurred here were typically counterparts of creatures that dwelled in arctic regions.
Quasi-Elements.[[Quasi-Elemental Plane of Dust]]: Animentals were an uncommon occurrence in this elemental plane. The type most typically encountered were reflections of [[wolves]].
Quasi-Elements.[[Quasi-Elemental Plane of Lightning]]: There were known to exist animental counterparts of [[constrictor snake]]s.
Quasi-Elements.[[Quasi-Elemental Plane of Salt]]: Nearly all animentals on this elemental plane were reflections of creatures common in deserts, such as [[scorpion]]s, [[monstrous scorpion]]s, and [[snake]]s.
Quasi-Elements.[[Quasi-Elemental Plane of Steam]]: There were known to exist animental counterparts of [[stag]]s.
Quasi-Elements.[[Quasi-Elemental Plane of Vacuum]]: Animentals were a rare occurrence in this plane, to the point that some mistakenly believed that none ever manifested in it. Animental whales were one of the few known to occur here.
